infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_locker: A Card-Protected Lockaway that only your crew can access. Useful for open-access weapons, as unrecognised personel cannot use its contents.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_cowboy: A hat made of crawler-leather that just feels plain good to wear, and seals your status as the gunslinger-type.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_trenchcoat: An exotic Thresher-leather longcoat that's thick enough to protect from both creature and cold, but light enough to showboat comfortably over your uniform.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_longrangeradio: Links up with the user's headset to broadcast at a significantly longer range than normal. Has a few pockets on the sides for spare equipment. It may need to be recalibrated in a fabricator to use the radio equipment properly.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bobag: A Hardcase with a built-in range extender for radio equipment that attach to the existing system for the Black-Ops Rig. It comes with a few deeper-than-usual pockets for spare munitions, as well as a sling for putting heavy weapons away, and out of sight. It may need to be recalibrated in a fabricator to use the radio equipment properly.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_exogear: A heavy-duty exoskeletal rigging used predominantly by miners and cargo technicians for easy transport of materials and heavy equipment, it has cargo mounting points, including one for securing large items to the chassis, and has the ability to handle high amounts of physical duress from handheld equipment. It uses a Radioisotope Thermoelectric generator to provide power, requiring a fuel rod to function.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_zealotrobes: A reinforced set of cultist robes that uses metamaterials interweaved with kevlar to achieve both a modern defensive capability, and appease the Calyx within, letting it mend wounds before your eyes.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_fieldcap: Regulation wear, when a ballistic helmet is updressing the job, but you still want something on your noggin'.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_fieldcap2: Regulation wear, when a ballistic helmet is updressing the job, but you still want something on your noggin'. This one uses coloration that's more befitting of a Separatist.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_fieldcapb: Regulation wear, when a ballistic helmet is updressing the job, but you still want something on your noggin'. Paired with a bandana, to help hide your identity.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_fieldcap2b: Regulation wear, when a ballistic helmet is updressing the job, but you still want something on your noggin'. Paired with a bandana, to help hide your identity. This one uses coloration that's more befitting of a Separatist.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_combatmedicuniform: A uniform with a unique looking digital camouflage printed onto it. It features thick aramid padding and larger pockets for equipment. Bloodstains are hard to wash out of clothing.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_renegadecombatmedi: A uniform meant to distinguish the wearer from Coalition medics, however is made with less materials and compromises protection and capacity for greater agility. Bloodstains are hard to wash out of clothing.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_lightuniform: A 2-piece, professional looking Coalition BDU, providing a comfortable means of identifying oneself. I guess you decided it's time to roll up your sleeves, huh?
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_lightuniform2: A set of BDU that is not quite of Coalition pattern, or Separatist set-up, as it shares components from both. All you can tell, is that this belonged to a veteran of Europan warfare.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_mercenaryarmor: A set of armor that gives notable armor coverage without being too heavy or inhibiting. it's somewhat damaged but remains servicable, as it shows no damage or blood that would be present if a blow was fatal.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_brawlerclothes: A set of clothes that do not take any extra bulk around the arms, as to allow full range of unrestricted motion. Allows the user to operate and swing weapons faster.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_renegadeuniform: A standard issue Separatist uniform, providing a small amount of protection though allows for slightly more agile movement. I guess just ripping off your sleeves is just too punk, huh?
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_combatrig: An extremely experimental combat suit, designed for the Coalition Black-Ops. A Uniform with advanced alloys and flexible joints, it allows a great deal of protection from gunfire, while keeping the user mobile enough to evade and reposition in the case of overwhelming force. The proprietary attachment system allows specialized components, but they will not work without the rig itself.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boshotgun: A tactical mag-fed design, suppressed for use by Black-Ops. Using Renegade-style 12 gauge magazines, it substantially increases overall menueverability of the weapon, as well as reduce the required user-effort to reload.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bopmr: A 7.62x67mm straight-pull rifle, suppressed to the liking of the Black-Ops, using a bullpup frame to allow a longer barrel behind the suppressor, though it needs to be stowed on the back due to it's sheer akwardness. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boarmorhaz: A set of additive components that attach to the proprietary system of the Black-Ops Rig. The Hazardous Environment Variants were developed to completely seal the user against biological and other CBRN threats when paired with the helmet, when such is used in the field, and comes with pockets for drugs and antidotes. Rated for 3000m Pressure.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boarmorleg: A set of additive components that attach to the proprietary system of the Black-Ops Rig. The Mobility Assist Variants are a little clunky, as the straps don't allow other armors to be worn, however they passively boost the users mobility, and keeps them on their feet.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boarmorhvy: A set of additive components that attach to the proprietary system of the Black-Ops Rig. The Heavy Engagement Variants are made to provide additional frontal armor, and aid in weapons usage at the cost of some flexibility.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boarmorsap: A set of additive components that attach to the proprietary system of the Black-Ops Rig. The Explosive Diffusal Variants are sensors wired throughout the rig to sense electromagnetic fields and give a view of electrical systems, alongside kevlar wrappings to secure the user against explosives, though these cover some of the color indicators.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_blackopshelm: An optimised helmet giving full view of the combat sector, suited for Coalition Black-Ops. While providing great protection from gunfire, it's lightweight structure allows more comfortable movement and weapons use.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_blackopshelm2: An optimised helmet giving full view of the combat sector, suited for Coalition Black-Ops. Using heavier plates, it allows more intensive situations to come out more favorably with less injuries incurred.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_blackopshelm3: An optimised helmet giving full view of the combat sector, suited for Coalition Black-Ops. With hermetical seals and a line for a gas tank, it keeps the user safe from most hazards without complicating the situation, as it will engage the regulator automatically, though it requires the panels to complete a seal for CBRN.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_blackopshelm4: An optimised helmet giving full view of the combat sector, suited for Coalition Black-Ops. Integrated with a tactical interface to key-in information about devices, it allows the user to interact with components with increased aptitude, though this was at a sacrifice to protection.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_tachelm: A Combat Helmet designed with integrated thermal optics, allowing for the wearer to have significantly better capabilities in close quarters. However, due to the bulky nature of the optics, armour plating has been reduced and therefore makes it less protective. The lenses are also sensitive to water and thus automatically turn off when submerged.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_medhelm: A Combat Helmet with a built in medical scanner, used to quickly evaluate an injured crew member's status whilst providing a notable degree of protection from small arms. The scanner used however is significantly more power hungry than it's standard issue counterpart and therefore requires third party batteries to remain functional.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bracers: A set of armored bracers that can defend against attacks fairly well and boasts enough weight and heft to hit through armor without injuring the wearer. It has high-voltage contacts interlacing the plates that can send a debilitating current into the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hbracers: A pair of reinforced bracers that's quite heavy, causing some difficulties staying balanced, though this extra weight goes both ways. It uses a high-speed pneumatic system to put more power behind the punch, capable of crushing almost any material like a ration can.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_sbracers: Some scrapped-up gloves to deal some damage in a pinch, it's lighter construction makes it not much better than a knife or wrench, though it can still block blows while being easy enough to make jabs with.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_wraps: Barely able to be considered gauntlets, it'll stop the biters from getting a good grip or knives a good cut, but it doesn't do much for padding. Users with a more physical skillset should be able to hit something without immediately regretting it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_basicsofcqc: A brief training guide that requires frequent refreshers to remember how to perform the moves in it, might be something with the ink or writing method. It teaches how to harden the whole body to resist strikes and staggers while keeping form. Something about this book feels Reptilian...
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_boknife: A durasteel tactical blade with an Incendium edge, slashing causes an extreme temperature change on contact, often gashing through materials with little resistance.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_f2k: A highly unusual looking suppressed 5.56x45mm rifle featuring an unconventional ejection system and somewhat alien shape, alongside having a full rifle length barrel in a more compact package. Produced for Black Ops who require a covert weapon that uses more available ammunition, though it doesn't accept extended magazines.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_xms: An odd rifle loading 6.5x39mm caseless, it's designed to keep it little more than a hoarse whisper, to the preference of Black-Ops Operatives. Though the cyclical rate is somewhat low, it's bolt and rifling have been improved to increase performance, letting it strike notably harder than other weapons of it's class.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_vhs: Loading 7.62x51, Coalition Black-Ops teams needed something with more "Knockdown Potential," in a more compact package. The bullpup design was used to keep the weapon relatively small and light, alongside integral suppressors to mask their presence when deep in enemy territory. The weapon uses a quick 4-round burst firemode to help with overall accuracy, and reduce ammunition waste.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_m90t: Designed for multi-role, the Assault Shotgun has a long and complicated service history. Sporting the 8-Gauge shell, it has a nasty habit of breaking faces, doors, and the occasional shoulder, as it's recoil is unforgiving, though there are some who take no less for traitors.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_inertial: Using a recoil-based inertia system to cycle the 8-Gauge shells, it has a surprising speed that it can dispatch, though the short barrel does no favors to precision.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_dbs: A retooled Double-Barrel shotgun, favored by Veterans of any side for it's reliability and commanding feel. With the ability to quickly drop both 8-Gauge shells in a moments notice, it often gets used in a defensive manner, as exchanging shells takes a while-too-long for gunfights.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_pasg: A stout 8-Gauge shotgun that uses well-designed components to increase shell effectiveness, while also substantially increasing recoil impulse.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_spas12: An 8-Gauge hybrid shotgun that allows the use of gas pressure to cycle the bolt, making quick back-to-back shots possible, but still letting unskilled users pump the handle to cycle the weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_gunslinger: A 10.9x33mmR Single-Action revolver, great choice for self-defense, due to it's light trigger pull, but requires the hammer to be drawn back for every subsequent shot. However, the simplicity allows for single-handed use, and more skilled individuals can re-balance it in their hands faster, allowing for quicker shots.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bastard: A scrapped-together weapon firing 5.45x39mm, it uses a side-loading open bolt, making accuracy an issue, but has a notable firing rate and capacity, which is astounding for a bastardized weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_levergun: A 9x33mm rifle utilizing a very old lever action system that is heavily outdated compared to most firearms on Europa. Despite the inherent antiquity, it is favoured by Coalition captains and citizens for making a rather puny cartridge more viable with it's longer barrel and 9 round tube. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_blaster: An attempt at generalized man-portable laser weaponry, it needs specialized cells to fire, due to it's output load required to discharge far exceeding a battery's capabilities. In it's current state, output is limited, though the load on the cell's the same.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_asmd: A variant of the Blaster with controls more like a conventional rifle, allowing better accuracy and handling, as well as adopting a precharger to make shots nearly immediate, though the recharge may prove to be cumbersome. It uses a silicon gel to absorb the heat coming from the weapon, making it safe to fire from even unskilled users.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_heavyblaster: An industrious solution to portable laser weaponry, it adopts higher-load capacitors to discharge hotter, though at the cost of a much longer warm-up. Very rarely usable in a firefight, but its ability to burn through personal armor has less competitors than conventional rifles.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bolter: A short rifle that runs on 12.7x55 by means of magazines. It adapts upon the Coalition's favored Oppressor Battle Rifle, built into a smaller package to increase concealability and without compromising utility. It's known to be unwieldy, often being too powerful for unskilled users, but it fits well in a commanding officers' hand.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_ppr: A semi-automatic 8.6x70mm rifle that neatly fits the Designated Marksman role, it has the ability to force through the majority of helmets and vests, while being quick enough for follow-up shots, in the case that one isn't enough.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_chemthrower: A large, bulky Chemfuel flamethrower designed by the Coalition to incinerate the most hardy of flora and fauna alike, shooting an intense stream of chemical fuel that can reach up to over 900 degrees and be used at significantly better ranges. However it's bulk makes it extremely difficult for a poorly trained user to operate.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_chemthrowerspitter: A light Chemfuel incendiary device, it ejects a sizable amount of chemical fuel at once, with intent for it to sit and burn, acting as a deterrent. Without aersolizing the fuel pre-ignition, it doesn't get intense enough to burn away flora, instead slowing down targets, as the fuel is very viscous when burning.
infotexts.entitydescription.heavyshotshell: Packed with 12 Steel pellets, the shell has a tendancy to take off doors and limbs alike. It does a better job punching through lighter armor than it's lesser counterpart, though can still make a mess of heavier plate.
infotexts.entitydescription.heavyhotshell: Stocked with Ignis-tipped darts, it penetrates through armor and surfaces, capable of leaving multiple targets heavily charred.
infotexts.entitydescription.heavystunshell: Seated with 4 rubber balls, other non-lethal options are suggested for unskilled users, with heavy recoil still being present.
infotexts.entitydescription.heavysliceshell: Contains a Titanium fragmenting slug that causes immense bleeding on target, even through heavy armor.
infotexts.entitydescription.glshotshell: Using 24 Steel BB's, the shell's the "short-range" option for explosive specialists to open a little breathing room of them without harming themselves in the process, though it's not much more effective than a shotshell.
infotexts.entitydescription.40mmbreach: A 40mm grenade with a shaped charge, intent on dealing intense structure damage. Soft targets are barely affected.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_bosmg: A 11.4x23 submachine gun with an extreme firerate and integral suppressor, it's favored by Black-Ops Scouts for its quick knock-down and ammo availablity, though it has a nasty habit of running through ammo very quickly, leading to users firing in short, controlled bursts
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_arpistol: Chambered in the intermediate 5.56x45, it has native armor piercing and capacity over any other pistol, but at the cost of a larger profile.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_usp: A boxy looking 10x25mm handgun, being favoured by most Coalition operators for it's substantially better power and penetration than both 9x19 and 11.4x23 pistols.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_mk23: A 10x25mm combat pistol, with integrated light and suppressor for use by Coalition Black-Ops. Needing something maneuverable, but hardy to keep as backup, the employment of more expensive alloys helps to lighten the overall weapon without compromising reliability.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_n99: This 10x25mm pistol has seen some better days, with dents and scratches from every discernable source, but just as reliable as ever. Recoil is extremely manageable, so don't worry about a Kick in the Head.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_auto10: An unorthodox 10x25mm design, with ported barrel and weight distribution for ease of handling during firing. It fires in 2-round bursts to maximize rounds on target, with it doing nothing more but a gentle bounce during its' function.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_apc: Loaded in 10x25mm, the weapon is often favored by boarding parties and ship defense crews for the quick output of damage, while the chunky design and stock mitigate the recoil considerably. The magwell accepts both extended and standard magazine types.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hpp: Designed to fire 10x25mm, it's easy to maintain and operate, though feels clanky. Weird design principals lead to it able to take extended magazines, which are often reserved for PDWs.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_raffica: A 10x25mm Machine Pistol, it has better ergonomics than its' more common Renegade counterpart, as well as coming with a burst function. It's extra forward weight helps users fire it more frequently, though it may take some extra skill and courage to switch it to burst.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hpc: Firing 10x25mm, its sturdy yet light construction leads to a controlable weapon, alongside with a closed bolt and foregrip, it allows for more accurate fire from less skilled individuals.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_mp5: Loaded with 10x25mm, it has notable accuracy and maneuverability while retaining a high degree of accuracy. While it may not be as fast as it's competitors, it may certainly outlast them.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_pasmg: A brisk-paced 10x25mm submachine gun with a specialty design, it sacrifices speed for accuracy, leaving the user open to close combat during operations. Though, it seems the 8-Gauge underbarrel was the solution to save this Alien of a weapon. It will automatically drop spent magazines, as to speed up reloads considerably.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_m79: A short-and-simple 40mm grenade launcher made for use by one hand, used by boarding crews to displace crowds and devastate rooms before lead starts flying. It's lower launch velocity hinders it's range.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_napalm: A high density flammable fuel mixture, designed specifically for the Chemthrower to start an inferno.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hbcell: Disposable High-Amp Supercapacitor designed for Blasters. Better made cells can get more shots before the entropy destroys it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hbcell2: Disposable High-Amp Supercapacitor designed for Blasters. Having the diodes aligned in parallel instead of series lets the pulse divide, while also increasing the max overall damage due to less strain on the lenses.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_hbcellovercharge: Disposable High-Amp Supercapacitor designed for Blasters. Made and powered by alien components, the plasma discharged is extremely volatile, causing a large blast wave comparable to a nuclear reaction. It is of note that it has extremely reduced capacity compared to other cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_10mmmag: Holding 10 rounds of 10x25mm, the cartidge has a few fans due to native AP abilities, but the wrist-wrecking recoil will deter some users.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_10mmmagacid: Using 10x25mm "Phial" rounds, it trades direct damage to burn through the target's armor with acid. They are not very powerful on their own, but if the target is weak to acid...
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_10mmmagext: Holding 20 rounds of 10x25mm, some weapons cannot use this magazine due to it's bulky nature, though the separatists accounted for this in their designs.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_s63: Another work-around to use Coalition ammunition stores, this 5.56x45 LMG can take both Coalition standard rifle magazines and belt boxes. It's assembly is crude at best, so don't expect much from it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_medgas: A deployable canister of Europabrew, used to agitate wounds and volatile substances, as to make each strike much more devastating. The dispersion is quick, but inefficient.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_ext: A single-use mini extinguisher, meant to put out fires before they have a chance to take-off.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_toolbox: A toolbox containing everything needed for repairs and fieldwork, with a few open pockets for stowing additional supplies. It's made of Iron. It's very Robust.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_wrench: A stronger and more balanced durasteel wrench.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_henrytac: A heavily updated, multi-calibre Repeater capable of chambering 9x29, 9x33 and 10.9x33, making it significantly more versatile at the cost of a complicated lever and bolt system that needs some decent skill to cycle correctly. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_crowbar: A weighty and durable wrecking bar made from durasteel. Sometimes it has to be a crowbar coming at them down a steel corridor.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_sealingtool: A small torch that makes quick work of welding thin walls and doors shut, though it's smaller flame does make larger fixes much more difficult alongside worse fuel economy.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_sledge: A nefarious alteration to a Sledgehammer, the forward head of the device is modified to be a cup for most small explosives, with an impact hammer to set off the charge when it hits anything.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_scythe: A trophy that works as a weapon, it's an omen of what is to come to those who deny. Users that are attuned are faster while wielding it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_syringeshotgun: A design questionable by most, it discharges all of it's held syringes in a moments notice. Good for injecting concoxions or intensifying one toxin. Pressure chambers require all others to discharge before they will refill automatically.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_rifle: A stark comparison to the more reliable bolt-action Coalition counterpart, it has a deeper internal magazine, with a self-actuating bolt. The gas system is notably unreliable, and pulls enough away from the round to cause decreased performance. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_rifleprototype: A .30 caliber rifle, it excels at penetrating armor with extreme efficiency using a coil/railgun hybrid principle, allowing it to deliver more devastating strikes, though this does cause the round to break apart on impact, making multiple penetrations impossible. A skilled Rifleman can make better use of this weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_tavor: Firing 5.56x45mm, similar designs have been found as ways to avoid registering a new weapon under early Coalition law that prevented ownership of certain automatic weapons. With some scuffs and marks telling of its use, it has seen the worse end of some creatures, but it's still ready for more abuse
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_fraggrenadebouquet: A hefty bundle of three fragmentation grenades held together with some string. Seems too heavy to be thrown far before it splits, but rigged to a detonator, can cause some havoc.
THROW IT THROW IT THROW IT!
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_pipebombbundle: A improvised cluster of three pipe bombs taped together. it's quite heavy, but the tape should hold up until either the fuse or a detonator melts it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_pipebombbundlebomb: THROW IT THROW IT THROW IT!
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_luregrenade: A device designed to attract Europas' denisens before detonating into a flower of explosive submunitons.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_heavymechanicsuit1: A set of clothing with all the bells and whistles for the tradesman, including a few pockets to store the tools or snacks. Though the inlaid padding helps with the comfort and protection of the wearer, it does hinder movement a little.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_heavymechanicsuit: A set of clothing with all the bells and whistles for the tradesman, including a few pockets to store the tools or snacks. Though the inlaid padding helps with the comfort and protection of the wearer, it does hinder movement a little. Maybe blue isn't your color.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_t5000: A large 8.6x70mm rifle designed for quickly and precisely taking out a single person, it is a rare sight on Europa given it's long range nich is very situational.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_t5000boxmag: A small 5 round 8.6x70mm box magazine containing FMJ ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.scp_m24: An 8.6x70mm rifle made to be an alternative to the Coalition's more fine-crafted Precision Rifle. The cartridge's recoil is intense as it clearly was a design that wasn't meant to use it.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_guitar: Intricately raveled with a golden linework, It holds a sorrow of a mariner's last ballad, awaiting for another lost soul to play it once more. Seems it just needs to be dried and tuned.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_headset: Allows remote communication among the crew. Has additional features to help reduce noise of heavy tools or equipment without dampening radio communications, as well as a fitted worklight.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_megascooter: A large, almost rideable scooter, capable of getting divers around much faster. It requires more power than it's smaller counterpart, as well as being much more cumbersome.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_binoculars: A pair of High-zoom lense tubes, capable of looking much farther than any scope.
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostassas: There's a small group of "Hyper-Lethal" targets at [location1] that have a high price on their heads, put on by the Separatist party. If blood flows, the Coalition wouldn't be too happy.
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutpostassassina: The Operatives have been successfully neutralized.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostassassin: The Black-Ops Operatives inside have been dealt with, undock to leave the outpost.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_adminskillbook:
A booklet containing uncensored details about some Black-Ops under the ice, and how they were performed, to the letter. Reading this feels like you've walked the steps in their boots.
This is an Admin item.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_admingenbook:
This covers everything to a more straight-forward degree, from how to replace motor chucks, to swerving around ice spires, and handling a firearm in an effective manner.
This is an Admin item.
infotexts.entitydescription.adminxpbook:
There's a very distinguishable 3-letter name on the front, though this doesn't explain why it has nonsensical phrases and coordnates. What is at North latitude, 28 degrees, 24 minutes, West longitude 80 degrees, 36 minutes? Is it worth some bizzare adventure?
This is an Admin item.
infotexts.entitydescription.sgt_adminmechbook: A boring step-by-step process to maintain an Exosuit, and some neat tricks to use it better. Atleast it has plenty of pictures.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armoryassault: Provides weapons of larger calibers, like the Assault Shotguns, Pistols and SMGs. Uses Coalition Arms.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armoryassaultse: Provides weapons of larger calibers, like the Assault Shotguns, Pistols and SMGs. Uses Separatist Arms.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringexos: Loads 2 exoskeleton riggings that can be worn over diving suits and armor, allowing the users to haul materials and use larger weapons without risk.
